page.title: 07Customs - May Day(1)
page.content:
{Customs}-{May Day}- by Emma Morton _________________
The{children}of Pytchley{School} celebrate May Day annually on the Saturday nearest to the first of May. At 2.30 p.m., the children start to process around the playground. The Garland Bearer leads the procession followed by the six Hoop Bearers. Behind them, the children who have no special job to do carry a garden cane which they have decorated themselves. These are followed by the two Sword Bearers who lead the two Attendants, and the May Queen follows last of all.
After the opening speech has been made the May Queen is crowned and the small children from the Infant School do an easy dance.
